overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The OMA3 Application Registry is a blockchain-based, permissionless registry of applications designed to replace centralized app store databases. Instead of relying on proprietary app store servers, this registry enables anyone to mint an application token, which can then be displayed and launched by compatible apps and websites.

registration-guide.title: Registration Guide
registration-guide.description: Anyone can mint a new application token using the OMA3 Application Registry.

tokenized-app.title: Tokenized Applications
tokenized-app.description: A tokenized application is an ERC-721 NFT with standardized metadata that describes the app, its ownership, and how it should be presented or launched. Below is a breakdown of each metadata field:
